text: Coenzyme A (CoA, CoASH, or HSCoA) is a coenzyme used in up to 4% of enzymatic reactions within all living cells. Notably, it is used in fatty acid synthesis, the Krebs cycle, and the oxidation of pyruvate to acetyl-CoA. == Gallery == Image:Coenzym A beschriftet.svg|Coenzyme A Category:Cellular respiration Category:Metabolism
title: Coenzyme A
